roleset.name: supervise, watch over, removing/relaxing regulation
roleset.note: DEREGULATE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'deregulate' based on transformation of frames for 'regulate.' No sentences examined. entry. (from deregulate.01-v predicate notes)
DEREGULATION-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No corresponding VNcls. (from deregulation.01-n)

roles.note: Differs from 'deregulate' in the addition of start/end states, args 2 and 3. (from deregulation.01-n)

example.name: stated regulator
example.text: The finding probably will support those who argue that the U.S. should deregulate the class of asbestos including crocidolite more stringently than the common kind of asbestos, chrysotile, found in most schools and other buildings, Dr. Talcott said.
example.arg: the class of asbestos including crocidolite
more stringently than the common kind of asbestos, chrysotile, found in most schools and other buildings

example.name: unstated agent
example.text: ``Such research may ultimately result in the ability to regenerate damaged tissues or to turn off genes that cause cancer'' or *trace* to deregulate genes that cause Down's syndrome, the leading cause of mental retardation, according to an NIH summary.
example.arg: genes that cause Down's syndrome, the leading cause of mental retardation, according to an NIH summary

example.name: with start state
example.text: Availability of emergency contraception after its deregulation from prescription-only status: a survey of Ontario pharmacies.

example.name: arg 1
example.text: Australia experienced deregulation of their labor market during the late 1980s
